prompt_to_run:
You will be given a task consisting of two parts:
1. A word-learning phase where you will be shown examples of a new word and give a similarity score of the word.
2. A similarity judgement phase where you will be asked to rate the similarity of pairs of objects for a total of 50 objects.


Mr. Frog speaks a different language, and you are helping him to pick out the object he wants. You'll be given a novel word and some examples of the word.

Here is a lig:
1. box truck

Now pick out the other ligs from the following list:
1. car
2. full-trailer truck
3. Labrador
4. box truck
5. carrot
6. bee
7. green bell pepper
8. bear
9. basset hound
10. red bell pepper
11. yellow bell pepper
12. cat
13. pumpkin
14. onion
15. loader
16. school bus
17. Dalmatian
18. eggplant
19. chiller truck
20. seal
21. crane


Next, for each pair of the objects below, rate the similarity of the two objects on a scale of 1 (not similar at all) to 9 (extremely similar). Try your best to base your ratings on the same aspects of the objects that were important to you in making your choices during the word-learning phase:

1. semi-trailer truck and toucan
2. potato and Labrador
3. tractor and motorcycle
4. box truck and terrier
5. garbage truck and full-trailer truck
6. green bell pepper and Labrador
7. school bus and seal
8. yellow bell pepper and pig
9. school bus and Labrador
10. Labrador and pig
11. bear and carrot
12. potato and mutt
13. cat and garbage truck
14. cat and red bell pepper
15. potato and Dalmatian
16. carrot and Dalmatian
17. pumpkin and Dalmatian
18. bear and tractor
19. potato and full-trailer truck
20. motorcycle and Labrador
21. basset hound and crane
22. terrier and mutt
23. seal and full-trailer truck
24. potato and eggplant
25. school bus and basset hound
26. pumpkin and tractor
27. full-trailer truck and mutt
28. pumpkin and yellow bell pepper
29. pumpkin and pig
30. pumpkin and onion
31. semi-trailer truck and box truck
32. potato and red bell pepper
33. loader and tractor
34. car and seal
35. green bell pepper and bear
36. semi-trailer truck and eggplant
37. onion and mutt
38. semi-trailer truck and loader
39. potato and onion
40. carrot and mutt
41. garbage truck and red bell pepper
42. onion and eggplant
43. car and terrier
44. garbage truck and motorcycle
45. loader and eggplant
46. basset hound and mutt
47. carrot and toucan
48. crane and bee
49. bear and car
50. onion and full-trailer truck


The output should be formatted as a JSON instance that conforms to the JSON schema below.

As an example, for the schema {"properties": {"foo": {"title": "Foo", "description": "a list of strings", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["foo"]}
the object {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]} is a well-formatted instance of the schema. The object {"properties": {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]}} is not well-formatted.

Here is the output schema:
```
{"properties": {"objects_chosen": {"description": "objects that the word applied to", "items": {"type": "string"}, "title": "Objects Chosen", "type": "array"}, "choice_explanation": {"description": "explanation of objects chosen", "title": "Choice Explanation", "type": "string"}, "similarity_score": {"additionalProperties": {"type": "integer"}, "description": "similarity score for each pair of objects", "title": "Similarity Score", "type": "object"}}, "required": ["objects_chosen", "choice_explanation", "similarity_score"]}
```

Please be sure to give similarity scores to ALL 50 pairs of objects listed above.

results.choice_explanation: I selected vehicles or equipment that have the capability to transport or lift large items or people, similar to the example of a box truck. I excluded common cars and non-vehicle related items.
